benchmark_details.name: PerfCurator
benchmark_details.overview: PerfCurator is a repository mining tool designed to identify performance-related bug-fix commits at scale. It employs the PcBERT-KD model to classify commits, producing a large-scale dataset of performance-related bug-fixes across multiple programming languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale curated dataset of performance-related commits, aiding in the development of better performance bug detection tools.

data.annotation: Annotated using heuristic supervision and knowledge distillation

methodology.calculation: F1 Score calculated based on precision and recall of performance commits.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 Scores indicate better performance in identifying performance-related commits.
methodology.baseline_results: Keyword-filtering baseline achieved an F1 Score of 0.59.
methodology.validation: Validated through manual review of a statistically significant sample of commits.
